item.title: White van basically abandoned, 14th November
item.description:
This white van inside the dunnock mews parking area is constantly sitting there not moving and only gets used once a year its a very big problem because people cant find places to park there cars while that white van stays there for the whole year
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunnock Mews, Hackney, London

item.title: Streetlights are not working properly, 14th November
item.description:
Streetlights are not working properly as they only switch on after 6pm, while the sun goes down at 4pm - pitch dark until 6, Very dangerous, as pavements aren't perfect, people can and do fall, and darkness attracts crime too. Attached image illustrates a large local area, dozen of streets are affected. This is an ongoing issue since the end of British Summer Time (26th Oct) , and reported as early as 29th October.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Edmunds Avenue, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped household renovations waste, 14th November
item.description:
Yet again people are dumping household renovations waste outside the penge east dry cleaners. It is becoming their favourite dumping spot and it's unsightly for those of us who live nearby and have to pass by every day. This waste has been there about 3 days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Newlands Park, Penge, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: 2 street lamp covers dumped on our property, 14th November
item.description:
2 street lamp covers have been dumped at the front of our property. I was tempted to put them in the metal bin for recycling, but I assume the council would rather recover these and reuse them?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London Borough of Bromley
